meanings.definition: To allocate or distribute (something) incorrectly or unfairly.
meanings.sent1: She was misallotting the snacks, giving more to some kids and none to others.
meanings.sent2: The manager was accused of misallotting the budget, causing financial problems for the company.
meanings.sent3: The magician was misallotting the playing cards, making the game impossible to win.
meanings.sent4: The teacher felt like she was misallotting her time, spending too much on one subject and neglecting others.
meanings.sent5: The chef was misallotting the ingredients, resulting in a dish that tasted completely off.

meanings.definition: The act of wrongly distributing or assigning something.
meanings.sent1: The misallotting of resources led to chaos in the organization.
meanings.sent2: He discovered the misallotting of duties when some tasks were left undone.
meanings.sent3: The misallotting of seats at the event caused confusion among the guests.
meanings.sent4: The misallotting of prizes at the competition left many participants disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The misallotting of responsibilities among the team members resulted in missed deadlines.
